page.title: 06CHANGES IN CRADLEY SCHOOL
page.content: There were four classrooms heated by a fire or stove.Two were separated by a sliding wooden partition.Windows were high in walls. Then windows were enlarged and lowered Central heating was installed a new infant cloakroom built,the two partitioned classrooms were made into a hall and a gymnasium and a new prefabricated classroom were added.A playing field was made and the playground enlarged. A learner pool was built by parents.Another classroom and cloakroom were added and a classroom has been converted to a library.Below the school is Cowhill.It was a steep grazing meadow and toboggan slope in the winter.The steep slope was filled in with soil and rock from Ridgeway road improvements.A bungalow was built on the site. Opposite the school is Kings Orchard, a new housing development.
